rename.from: [depth_from_video_in_the_wild] How to train with images sequences only?
rename.to: [depth_from_video_in_the_wild] How to train with image sequences only?

body: I would also like to know.

I guess you can create an all-black mask image for every input frame. And use struct2depth's gen_data scripts to generate the training data (horizontally stacked frames). Depending on your dataset, the camera matrix can be calculated by rescaling the provided ground truth intrinsics. Or you can simply set the flag  "learn_intrinsics" to False.
@yifuhu yeah. I did it. I managed to train using the current code.
@cognitiveRobot did you have trouble loading pre-trained weights from the ImageNet checkpoint? It seems that the beta weights for batchnorms are not properly saved in the checkpoint file.
@yanfengliu thanks. where did you find the checkpoint file?

@cognitiveRobot Hi, How did you train the model without the cam.txt file?
Just set the flag "learn_intrinsics" to false? 

I am trying to train on my own dataset, and thinking about set the flag "learn_intrinsics" to True, and set cam.txt content to nine zeros, is that correct?

Thanks!

@cognitiveRobot Btw, did you use all-black mask image like @yifuhu said?
Thanks!
@pigletsc yes. I did and can train. But loss is too much, as I didn't have the checkpoint file to initialize.

@cognitiveRobot thanks for the reply.
What kind of error messages did you get?

> @cognitiveRobot thanks for the reply.
> What kind of error messages did you get?

I meant to say loss is too much.

> > @cognitiveRobot thanks for the reply.
> > What kind of error messages did you get?
> 
> I meant to say loss is too much.
Hi !! please tell me how you made it work without input of intrinsics ?? i put  cam.txt = 9 zeros like @pigletsc said but i keep getting error 

Mostly  : **tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.InvalidArgumentError: Input is not invertible.
	 [[{{node data_loading/multi_scale_intrinsics/MatrixInverse}}]]**


thanks !
